abstract: Buddhists taking part in life-release ceremony in Central Park, in which captive animals are freed as means of bringing good karma to animals and humans, have adapted ceremony so that only native species are freed; leaders at Grace Gratitude Buddhist Temple in Chinatown have partnered with wildlife rescuers and rehabilitation groups in response to concerns from environmentalists.
lead_paragraph: Buddhists priests and local wildlife rescuers partner to ensure a more responsible release ritual, in which rehabilitated animals are freed in their natural habitats.

headline.main: A Rite to Improve Karma for Man, Creature and, Now, the Environment
headline.print_headline: A Rite to Improve Karma for Man, Creature and, Now, the Environment

snippet: Buddhists priests and local wildlife rescuers partner to ensure a more responsible release ritual, in which rehabilitated animals are freed in their natural habitats.
